summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on South Sudan, determines that the situation in South Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, it decides to extend the mandate of UNMISS, as set out in resolution 2729 (2024), until 9 May 2025, and authorizes UNMISS to use all necessary means to carry out its tasks. The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
